adrs.title: ADR-0001: Automated NPM Releases with Semantic Release
adrs.summary: Implement Semantic Release for automated NPM publishing with version management and changelog generation.

adrs.title: ADR-0002: English as Primary Language for Documentation and Comments
adrs.summary: Establish English as the mandatory language for all project documentation, comments, and textual content.

adrs.title: ADR-0003: No CLI Parameter Overrides - Document-Centric Design
adrs.summary: Establish that XTOON documents are self-describing and portable. All processing parameters must be specified in XML attributes, not CLI flags. CLI is for input/output paths and process control only.

adrs.title: ADR-0004: RFC 4180 CSV Quoting and Escaping
adrs.summary: Adopt RFC 4180 as the authoritative CSV quoting and escaping specification for XTOON row parsing, with clarifications for tail capture and error handling.

adrs.title: ADR-0005: Column Definition Syntax and Formal Grammar
adrs.summary: Defines the formal EBNF grammar for xt:table column definitions, including attribute/element syntax, modifier arguments, tail capture placement, whitespace handling, and validation rules for duplicate column names.

adrs.title: ADR-0006: QName Resolution and Namespace Handling
adrs.summary: Defines when and how XML QNames and namespaces are resolved in XTOON templates, establishing a two-phase approach (parse-time syntax validation, expansion-time URI resolution) and confirming standard XML namespace inheritance rules apply.

adrs.title: ADR-0007: xml() Modifier Parsing Mode and Behavior
adrs.summary: Defines the xml() modifier as a strict fragment parser with self-contained namespace handling, preservation of all valid XML node types, fail-fast error handling for document-level constructs, and an internal wrapper mechanism that never appears in output.

adrs.title: ADR-0008: JSON Modifier Mapping Rules
adrs.summary: Defines the complete JSON-to-XML conversion rules for the json() modifier, including type mapping, invalid key handling, nested structure support, and security constraints to prevent prototype pollution and resource exhaustion.
